alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Northwest Carter; Southeast Carter; Sullivan; Unicoi (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 4:33PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN SULLIVAN...NORTHEASTERN UNICOI...JOHNSON AND CARTER COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 532 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of Abingdon to 8 miles east of Banner Hill. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elizabethton, Mountain City, Hampton, Unicoi, Hunter, Roane Mountain State Park, Neva, Laurel Bloomery, Hampton Creek Cove State Park, and Limestone Cove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east Tennessee.

area.areaDesc: Johnson; Northwest Carter; Southeast Carter; Sullivan; Unicoi
